result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

11:37 AM Defendant Pierre L Abarca Jr in court.  Attorney Preston James Smead in court for Pierre L Abarca Jr.  Attorney Robin W Lee in court for State of Wisconsin.  Not ready to resolve, has new case.  Defense not asking for trial. Court will set for a plea/s and may convert to scheduling conference.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Trial Judge - Br 13

8:43 AM Defendant Pierre L Abarca Jr in court.  Attorney Preston James Smead in court for Pierre L Abarca Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
